definitions: the state of having normal physical functions suspended or slowed down for a period of time; deep sleep

examples.text: the insects are able to enter prolonged states of dormancy, allowing them to resist freezing
unfortunately, after a long dormancy, this pest is making a big comeback

shortDefinitions: state of having normal physical functions suspended for period of time

definitions: the state in which a plant is alive but not actively growing

examples.text: dormancy allows woody plants to survive these unfavorable conditions

shortDefinitions: state of being alive but not actively growing

examples.text: some large volcanoes spend thousands of years in a state of dormancy

definitions: the state in which a disease causes no symptoms but is not cured and is liable to recur

examples.text: various animal models have been used to study the dormancy of tuberculosis in humans

shortDefinitions: the state in which a disease causes no symptoms but is not cured

definitions: the state of being temporarily inactive or inoperative

examples.text: his prolonged dormancy ended with the publication of Collected Poems

shortDefinitions: state of being temporarily inactive or inoperative
